suncertify.db

Interface DBMainExtended

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DBMain
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Data

    public interface DBMainExtended
extends DBMain
    DBMainExtended extends DBMain, the common interface for any data access objects in the persistence layer. It defines two extra methods, initialize and save, used for initializing the data access object on and persisting records to disk respectively.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int create(String[] data)
      Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry).
      void delete(int recNo)
      Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse.
      int[] find(String[] criteria)
      Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.
      void initialize(String dbFilePath)
      This method is responsible for initializing field variables, loading the contents of the database file specified into the in-memory cache and adding the shutdown hook to ensure that the contents of the cache is written back to the database file when the application is shut down.
      boolean isLocked(int recNo)
      Determines if a record is currently locked.
      void lock(int recNo)
      Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client.
      String[] read(int recNo)
      Reads a record from the file.
      void saveRecords()
      Writes the record cache to the database file, overwriting the existing record data stored in the database file.
      void unlock(int recNo)
      Releases the lock on a record.
      void update(int recNo, String[] data)
      Modifies the fields of a record.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        int create(String[] data)
    throws DuplicateKeyException,
           IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.
        Specified by:
        create in interface DBMain
        Parameters:
        data - a string array where each element is a record value.
        Returns:
        the record number of the new record.
        Throws:
        DuplicateKeyException - If an existing record in the database, which has not been marked as deleted, contains the same key specified in the given data.
        IllegalArgumentException - If data is null, number of elements in data exceeds record fields or number of characters used in a field exceeds the max number of characters permitted for that field.

      • delete

        void delete(int recNo)
        Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface DBMain
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number.

      • find

        int[] find(String[] criteria)
    throws RecordNotFoundException,
           IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)
        Specified by:
        find in interface DBMain
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria.
        Returns:
        an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the specified record does not exist or is marked as deleted in the database.
        IllegalArgumentException - If criteria is null, number of elements in data exceeds record fields or number of characters used in a field exceeds the max number of characters permitted for that field.

      • initialize

        void initialize(String dbFilePath)
         throws DatabaseAccessException,
                IllegalArgumentException
        This method is responsible for initializing field variables, loading the contents of the database file specified into the in-memory cache and adding the shutdown hook to ensure that the contents of the cache is written back to the database file when the application is shut down.
        Parameters:
        dbFilePath - the filePath of the database file.
        Throws:
        DatabaseAccessException - If the specified database file does not contain the expected magic cookie value or some I/O related exception occurred when attempting to read the file.
        IllegalArgumentException - If dbFilePath is null

      • isLocked

        boolean isLocked(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException
        Determines if a record is currently locked. Returns true if the record is locked, false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        isLocked in interface DBMain
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number
        Returns:
        true, if is locked
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the specified record does not exist or is marked as deleted in the database

      • lock

        void lock(int recNo)
   throws RecordNotFoundException
        Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. If the specified record is already locked, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface DBMain
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the specified record does not exist or is marked as deleted in the database

      • read

        String[] read(int recNo)
       throws RecordNotFoundException
        Reads a record from the file. Returns an array where each element is a record value
        Specified by:
        read in interface DBMain
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number
        Returns:
        a string array where each element is a record value
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - If the specified record does not exist or is marked as deleted in the database

      • saveRecords

        void saveRecords()
          throws IOException,
                 IllegalStateException
        Writes the record cache to the database file, overwriting the existing record data stored in the database file. This method should be called when the application terminates in order to persist any database changes to the database file, i.e. sometime after the method initialize has been called to initialize the data access object.
        Throws:
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred when writing the records to disk.
        IllegalStateException - If this method has been invoked before the method initialize.

      • unlock

        void unlock(int recNo)
        Releases the lock on a record.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface DBMain
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number

      • update

        void update(int recNo,
            String[] data)
     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n].
        Specified by:
        update in interface DBMain
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number
        data - a string array where each element is a record value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If data is null, number of elements in data exceeds record fields or number of characters used in a field exceeds the max number of characters permitted for that field.
